results.title: Anything you want to be
results.brief_description: A tongue-in-cheek history of a girl who could be anything she wanted - but her parents gave her dolls. In High School she decided to stand for class president but had to settle for being secretary. Vocational guidance placed her in nursing, rather than medicine. She then tried sports but a boy beat her. While developing her mind, she read cookbooks. Finally, she decided to be a woman - whatever that is!

results.title: Anyplace but here
results.creator_credit: C B S News, Tom Spain and Maurice Murad
results.brief_description: Examines the dilemma facing the mentally ill in America and the people who try to help them. With the advent of stabilising drugs, more patients are returning to the community. However, unless the patients have homes to return to they are released into communities unprepared to either accept or treat them. Follows three patients on their separate paths as they seek their release from a psychiatric centre.

results.title: Anyone can be a genius
results.creator_credit: Bush Christmas Productions, Channel Communications and Julian Russell
results.brief_description: This is a film about the meaning of life, about why the human brain is the most extraordinary thing ever created. Sit back and watch the exploding rocket, the eccentric animation, what it means to be a parent, Land Rights, the re-enactment of Archimedes and listen to the 21 original compositions of music. Or look at Latin America in a way you’ve never seen before. Narrated by Noni Hazlehurst.

results.title: Anyone anything anywhere
results.creator_credit: Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations, Vincent Donovan and Don Scheldrup
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sentinel”.
Despite its low profile, the transport element of the Royal Australian Airforce is one of the largest air carriers in Australia. It has both national and international commitments and is capable of delivering anyone, or almost anything, anywhere in the world. Narrated by Peter Gwynne. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Anybody's son will do
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Bill Brind, John Kramer and Paul Cowan
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “War”.
Offers unusually frank insights into techniques that all armies use to motivate recruits. The film takes us to Parris Island Marine Recruit Training Depot in South Carolina, USA, to observe the rituals that will transform a motley group of eighteen year-olds into soldiers of the United States Marine Corps, unquestionably the roughest, toughest branch in the US military. It is a gripping study of what it takes to change ordinary civilians into the staple of wars, soldiers ready to kill, even to die for their country.

results.title: Anybody's problem
results.creator_credit: Basic Films, Leon Clore and John Fletcher
results.brief_description: In Britain, the Citizens’ Advice Bureaux give free and expert counsel on problems as different as an eviction threat, the making of a will, a broken marriage and a scooter accident. Shot in Stevenage New Town, the film also illustrates the pattern of life in this new community, one of several designed to ease the population pressure on London.

results.title: Any time, any place
results.brief_description: This documentary presented by the United States National Parks Service, expresses concern that man has become separate from nature. While many humans still exist as they did centuries ago, modern man has built a wall against nature. Calls for teaching to inspire and regain an interest in nature. Suitable for Upper Primary and Secondary level students.

results.title: Any questions?
results.creator_credit: Seven Dimensions, Victorian Film Corporation and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: Discussion starter looking at the problems of generating group discussions. After completing a complicated explanation, a trainer asks questions of the group. In his despair at failing to elicit questions he jumps out the window.
